title: Anisimova upsets Sabalenka for latest win of resurgent career
description: Even Anisimova was shocked when she pulled off the ultimate upset, defeating No. 1 Sabalenka in the Wimbledon semifinal.
author: D'Arcy Maine

title: American Anisimova stuns top-ranked Sabalenka
description: Amanda Anisimova upset No. 1-ranked Aryna Sabalenka 6-4, 4-6, 6-4 at Wimbledon on Thursday to reach the first Grand Slam final of her career. She will face Iga Swiatek, who defeated Belinda Bencic 6-2, 6-0.

title: The Wimbledon finalist who lost in qualifying last year
description: A year ago, Amanda Anisimova was doing her best to avoid thinking about Wimbledon after failing to qualify for the main draw. Now she has a final to prepare for.

title: Sabalenka 'kept reminding self' smashing racquets 'not an option'
description: The last time Aryna Sabalenka gave a news conference after a difficult Grand Slam loss, she handled it badly. Wimbledon was a little different.

title: Unlock the Perfect Slice Serve - Essential Tennis Podcast #415
description: The wide slice serve is a CRITICAL tool to have in your tool box. It pulls opponents out of position, opens the court up for you to hit into, exposes their usually weaker backhand side, and forces them to run twice as far for the next shot - if they even get it at all. Let’s take a deep dive into how YOU can develop this powerful weapon, step by step in this special episode of the Essential Tennis Podcast.
author: Essential Tennis LLC

title: 3 Djokovic Secrets To Winning More Matches - Essential Tennis Podcast #414
description: In this special episode of the Essential Tennis Podcast, you're going to learn the top 3 tactical secrets of Novak Djokovic that you can apply in your very next match. Use these tools to gain precision, consistency, and offense to make your opponents more uncomfortable, win more points, and win more matches.
author: Essential Tennis LLC

title: What is the Wimbledon tennis schedule?
description: Carlos Alcaraz continues his quest for a Wimbledon three-peat Friday when he faces Taylor Fritz at 1:30 p.m. local time. Then, top seed Jannik Sinner clashes against seven-time champion Novak Djokovic in a blockbuster semi-final. View the day's featured matches below and the full order of play here. Centre Court (starts 1:30 p.m.)  [2] Carlos Alcaraz (ESP) vs. [5] Taylor Fritz (USA) [1] Jannik Sinner (ITA) vs. [6] Novak Djokovic (SRB) Read More from Wimbledon: Djokovic cancels on-site practice ahead of SF vs. Sinner Sinner & Djokovic eye contrasting milestones in blockbuster SF Inside Fritz's plan to shut down Alcaraz before he catches fire[NEWSLETTER FORM]

title: What were the Wimbledon results?
description: Home favourites Julian Cash and Lloyd Glasspool advanced to the Wimbledon doubles final on Thursday. They will next meet Rinky Hijikata and David Pel, who upset top seeds Marcelo Arevalo and Mate Pavic. View Thursday's featured results from the All England Club below and click here to see all scores. Centre Court [13] Amanda Anisimova (USA) def. [1] Aryna Sabalenka 6-4, 4-6, 6-4 [8] Iga Swiatek (POL) def. Belinda Bencic (SUI) 6-2, 6-0 Sem Verbeek/Katerina Siniakova def. Joe Salisbury/Luisa Stefani 7-6(3), 7-6(3) No. 1 Court Rinky Hijikata/David Pel def. [1] Marcelo Arevalo/Mate Pavic 6-7(2), 7-6(5), 7-6(9) [5] Julian Cash/Lloyd Glasspool def. [4] Marcel Granollers/Horacio Zeballos 6-3, 6-4 Read More from Wimbledon: Djokovic cancels on-site practice ahead of SF vs. Sinner Sinner & Djokovic eye contrasting milestones in blockbuster SF Inside Fritz's plan to shut down Alcaraz before he catches fire[NEWSLETTER FORM]

title: Wimbledon 2025 Day Ten Recap
description: The top half of the Wimbledon men’s draw held firm on Wednesday, as Jannik Sinner and Novak Djokovic both booked their places in the semi-final, though not without some questions. Sinner, who fluked his way into the last eight, showed no signs of discomfort as he dispatched Ben Shelton in straight sets, extending his head-to-head …
author: Jonathan

title: Wimbledon 2025 Day Nine Recap
description: Day Nine at Wimbledon unfolded without much drama, but with plenty of quality, as Taylor Fritz and Carlos Alcaraz both moved into the semi-finals in straightforward fashion. Fritz saw off Karen Khachanov in four sets, producing two dominant opening sets, navigating a mid-match lapse, and finishing the job in a composed tiebreak to reach his …
author: Jonathan
